decks.notes: This aggressive deck focuses on utilizing the partner commanders Tymna the Weaver and Bruse Tarl, Boorish Herder to maintain card advantage through combat and life gain. The deck aims to control the board with a wide variety of removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Terminate, and Swords to Plowshares, while also pressuring opponents with evasive threats like Bloodghast, Gifted Aetherborn, and Monastery Mentor. The deck also includes powerful synergies like Goblin Bombardment with creatures that can be sacrificed for value, as well as ways to disrupt opponents' game plans with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. This deck excels at applying pressure early in the game and maintaining tempo throughout the match.

The main concept of this Saskia the Unyielding aggro deck is to quickly deploy powerful creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan with removal spells and disruptive creatures. The deck aims to apply pressure early with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Thalia, Heretic Cathar, while also leveraging powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Feast and Famine to further enhance the board presence. The deck also includes a suite of removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Terminate, and Swords to Plowshares to handle opposing threats, as well as disruptive cards like Winter Orb and Tangle Wire to slow down the opponent's game plan. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, aggressive game plan while disrupting their strategies to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful planeswalkers, counterspells, and removal spells. Atraxa, Praetors? Voice serves as the commander, providing access to multiple colors for versatile spell options. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by controlling the board with cards like Wrath of God, Vindicate, and Toxic Deluge. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Sorin, Lord of Innistrad to generate card advantage and apply pressure. With a solid mana base and efficient ramp cards, the deck is able to consistently cast threats and answers while keeping the opponent on the back foot.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize Baral, Chief of Compliance's ability to reduce the cost of instants and sorceries, allowing for efficient control and card filtering. The deck focuses on a high number of cheap counterspells and card draw spells to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With access to a wide range of counterspells and removal options, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while setting up for a powerful win condition, such as casting Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or overwhelming the board with a large number of zombie tokens from Rise from the Tides. By controlling the game and generating advantage through card draw, the deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure a victory.

This deck is focused on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing powerful creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. The combination of Reyhan and Bruse Tarl provides a versatile and aggressive strategy, allowing for both combat damage and creature recursion. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures, such as Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Voice of Resurgence, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Swords to Plowshares. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful cards like Armageddon and Rancor to disrupt opponents and pump up its own creatures. The mana base is optimized to provide consistent access to all colors and support the aggressive game plan.

The main strategy of this deck is to utilize Meren of Clan Nel Toth's ability to constantly recur value creatures from the graveyard to generate incremental advantage over the opponent. By using cards like Birthing Pod, Survival of the Fittest, and Recurring Nightmare, the deck aims to assemble combos and take advantage of various synergies within the creature-centric theme. The deck includes powerful disruption tools like Acidic Slime and Massacre Wurm to control the board, while also including a range of tutors and card draw engines to ensure consistency in executing its game plan. Overall, the deck is focused on establishing a strong board presence, disrupting opponents' strategies, and eventually overwhelming them with powerful creature synergies and combos.

The deck revolves around the powerful legendary creature Sigarda, Host of Herons, who acts as a resilient and aggressive commander. The strategy focuses on establishing a board presence with efficient mana dorks and disruptive creatures, while also utilizing powerful equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice, Sword of Feast and Famine, and Umezawa's Jitte to deal damage and protect Sigarda. The deck also includes a suite of removal spells and disruptive cards to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent with fast threats and efficient creatures, while also protecting Sigarda and disrupting the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive play, utilizing low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Zurgo Bellstriker serves as the commander, providing a consistent source of damage. The main deck includes a variety of efficient creatures with haste and direct damage spells to apply pressure from the start of the game. Cards like Ankh of Mishra and Shrine of Burning Rage punish opponents for playing lands or not being able to deal with threats quickly. The goal of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast damage output, using a combination of creatures and burn spells to maintain board presence and close out the game swiftly.
